meanings.definition: Make (something) ready for use or consideration.
meanings.sent1: I will prepare my backpack for school tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She likes to prepare her notes before giving a presentation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to prepare its nest with shiny objects.
meanings.sent4: The team needs to prepare their strategy like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: He always prepares his tools meticulously before starting a project.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) ready or able to do or deal with something.
meanings.sent1: The coach will prepare the players for the big game.
meanings.sent2: Parents prepare their children for the challenges of adulthood.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to prepare his assistant for the disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: She prepared her friend for the surprise party by distracting her.
meanings.sent5: The mentor prepared the apprentice for the difficult task ahead.

meanings.definition: Get (food) ready to eat or drink.
meanings.sent1: I will prepare a delicious meal for dinner tonight.
meanings.sent2: She loves to prepare fresh smoothies in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to prepare a cake using only three ingredients.
meanings.sent4: He prepared a feast fit for a king on his birthday.
meanings.sent5: The barista prepared a perfect cup of coffee for the customer.
